resources.string: Audio initialization failed. Try other settings. Force Quit and restart might also help.
Audio setup failed. Try other settings.
Recording audio failed. Check if access is blocked. Restart device if necessary to gain back access.
Are you sure you want to force quit the app?
Are you sure you want to permanently delete all of the messages?

To be able to decode COFDMTV encoded text messages, Rattlegram needs access to the microphone. Having access to the microphone is considered to be a sensitive permission and you have the right to know what Rattlegram does with that access: The data recorded from the microphone is only used to feed the COFDMTV decoder and spectrum analyzer for the visualization of its frequency content. Rattlegram uses a very small temporary buffer in volatile memory and constantly overwrites that buffer with new data from the microphone. The resulting text message from the COFDMTV decoder is the only data that gets stored in persistent storage on your device.

Rattlegram %1$s
Copyright 2022 aicodix GmbH 

Please read WARNING and DISCLAIMER at the bottom of this page. 

Rattlegram transmits short text messages as COFDMTV encoded audio and is based on open-source software: 

OFDM modem implementation and specification:
https://github.com/aicodix/modem
BSD Zero Clause License 

Polar list and ordered statistics decoding:
https://github.com/aicodix/code
BSD Zero Clause License 

Digital signal processing:
https://github.com/aicodix/dsp
BSD Zero Clause License 

Fancy header font:
http://terminus-font.sourceforge.net
SIL Open Font License 

WARNING:
The higher sampling rates (44.1 and 48 kHz) enable carrier frequencies above 16 kHz for ultrasonic transmissions. Prolonged exposure to high pitched sounds can damage your hearing, even if you can't hear them.
